title: Learning Path: Nanite performance
ai_summary: The user is experiencing performance issues related to Nanite in Unreal Engine 5, likely manifesting as low frame rates or stuttering.
ai_what_you_learn: Enable 'Support Compute Skincache' in Project Settings -> Rendering to significantly improve skeletal mesh Nanite performance.
Adjust the 'Fallback Percent Triangles' setting in the Nanite settings of an object to control the reduction of triangles on lower LODs (try values between 0.5 and 0.8 as a starting point).
Use Nanite Visualization modes (e.g., Triangles, Material ID) to identify performance bottlenecks and areas with excessive detail.
Consider disabling Nanite on objects that are very small or far away from the camera, as the overhead might outweigh the benefits.

steps.description:

content.description:

steps.title: Step 2: Diagnose Your Issue
steps.description:
Before applying any fixes, you need to identify *where* the performance bottleneck lies. This step covers using visualization tools and understanding Nanite's performance characteristics.

👉 **Action:** Explore Nanite Visualization modes within the UE5 editor to pinpoint problem areas with high triangle density or rendering overhead.

content.title: Nanite | Inside Unreal
content.description:

steps.title: Step 3: Apply the Fix
steps.description:
Now that you know where the problem is, you can apply specific fixes. This step covers common optimization techniques for Nanite assets.

👉 **Action:** Experiment with reducing 'Fallback Percent Triangles' and enabling 'Support Compute Skincache' in your project settings.
steps.action: Experiment with reducing 'Fallback Percent Triangles' and enabling 'Support Compute Skincache' in your project settings.
